divs: Sighting DetailsOn the evening of 12 Aug 2007 I witnessed, along with my wife, a very bright, brilliant light traveling across the early evening sky. It was heading east, moving slowly. It made no sound that we could hear, never changed directions, and maintained the same speed throughout the sighting. We watched this event for approximately 30-40 seconds. The light faded away with distance. I thought it may be part of the meteor shower that we were planning on watching. However, it looked nothing like a shooting star. I am now convinced that it was not part of the nights meteor shower. I've been in the Navy for 9+ years and am currently stationed at NASWI in Oak Harbor, Washington. I work as a mechanic on Naval aircraft. I have seen many types of aircraft in flight throughout the years. This was like nothing I've ever seen.
Summary: Very Bright Star-like Light Traveling in Sky
trends: There have been 8 other sightings in Oak Harbor
There were no other sightings in Oak Harbor on or around August 12th 2007
